oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Edwin W. Craig receives award, 1962 May 03
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Edwin W. Craig, Chairman of National Life and Accident Insurance Company, receives a resolution from Mayor Ben West on May 3rd, 1962. Craig advised L&A’s board to venture into radio as a good marketing tool, and WSM-AM radio was born. Soon, the Grand Ole Opry radio show was introduced to become the best-known and longest running radio program in history. Craig was a leading figure in nationwide insurance circles, following his father’s footsteps to the presidency of the South’s largest insurance company. He was recognized as the father of radio station WSM. In 1934, he was instrumental in organizing the Clear Channel Broadcasting Service, a group of high-powered stations including WSM. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
